required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Tolerability of Encapsulated Iron Compared to a Conventional Iron Supplement Such as Fe Sulphate Regarding Gastrointestinal Side-effects

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: Cross-clinical trial in which the adverse effects of two different iron supplements are compared

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: This variable will measure the changes of gastrointestinal symptoms during the period of consumption, that is, for 14 days.]
primary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated by analog visual scale:nausea, vomiting, heartburn, abdominal pain, diarrhoea, constipation, breathless, headache, metallic taste and gas/bloating

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This variable will measure changes in health status during the period of consumption, that is, for 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated by analog visual scale

secondary_outcome.measure: quantification of the deterioration of daily activities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This variable will measure the changes that occur in activities of daily living during the period of consumption, that is, for 14 days.]
secondary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated by analog visual scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This variable will measure changes in bowel movements during the period of consumption, that is, for 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: They will be measured using the bristol scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This variable analyzes the change in the state of iron in blood twice. Before and after the consumption of the product under study, that is 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Ferritin (mg / dl) and hemoglobin (g / 100) will be measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This variable analyzes the changes before the consumption of the product under study and after 14 days of consumption.]
This variable analyzes changes in urine after 14 days of consumption
This variable analyzes changes before the consumption of the product under study and after 14 days of consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure (mmhg) and heart rate (beats per minute) are measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This variable analyzes changes before the consumption of the product under study and after 14 days of consumption
This variable analyzes changes in weight after 14 days of consumption
This variable analyzes changes before the consumption of the product under study and after 14 days of consumption

intervention.description: Consumption of an encapsulated iron supplement, orally two hours before eating.
Consumption of an encapsulated iron supplement, orally two hours before eating.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Healthy premenopausal women (Age: 18-50)
- Non-anemic
- Normal Iron status: hemoglobin (>12 g/dL)
- Normal BMI (20-25 kg/m²)
- Normal blood profile at screening:
a) Complete blood count, platelets, Glucose, HbA1c, Electrolytes (Na, K, Cl), AST, ALT, bilirubin, y-GT), Creatinine, eGFR, blood urea nitrogen, uric acid, Total protein (albumin/ globulin)
- Subject is in good physical health as established by medical history, vital signs, physical examination and electrocardiogram (ECG)
- Normal urine profile at screening:
a) pH, protein, glucose, nitrite, ketone, bilirubin, urobilinogen, red blood cells, leukocytes, creatinine, sediments, absence of bacteria
- Regular menstrual cycle (28 +/- 5)
- Willingness not to change dietary (no start/ change of diet) and general habits (quit smoking) during study duration
- C-reactive protein: < 5mg/L.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous participation in iron tolerability trials.
- Participation in a clinical research trial within 30 days prior to randomization
- Chronic medication (except oral contraceptives)
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Hb levels < 12g/dL (women) (anemia)
- Reported chronic disease
- Infectious disease
- Alcohol or drug abuse
- Hyperlipidemia as defined by LDL > 3.36 mmol/L (130 mg/dL) and/or triglycerides > 2.26 mmol/L (200 mg/dL).
- Relevant co-morbidities: Gastrointestinal disease such as peptic ulcer, enteritis, or ulcerative colitis, inflammation, pre-existing poorabsorption or liver disease, kidney disease, iron-storage disorders such as hemochromatosis, haemosiderosis, or chronic autoimmune inflammatory condition
- Serious illness that may confound study results or interfere with compliance
- Any other laboratory abnormality, medical condition or psychiatric disorder which in the Investigator's opinion may adversely affect the subject's ability to complete the study or its measures or which may pose significant risk to the subject
- Known intolerance to oral iron supplements
- Intake of iron suppl. and/or multivitamins containing iron during the last three months before study entry
- Use of any mineral/vitamin or other supplements during the past month prior to study
- Subject has a known allergy to the test material's active or inactive ingredients
- Individuals who are cognitively impaired and/or who are unable to give informed consent
- Any active medical illness in last 48 h
- Sexually-active females who are not willing to use an effective form of birth control.
- Subjects with sever severe premenstrual symptoms (PMS)
- Subjects that have followed specific diet, eg. high protein diet, within 30 days prior to study start
- Previous gastric bypass, sleeve gastrectomy, or gastric band surgery
- Blood donation within the previous 1 months.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
